title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdős Problem #666: C₆ in Hypercube Subgraphs**

Question: Does every ε-dense subgraph of Qₙ contain C₆?

**Answer:** NO

**Counterexamples:**
- Chung (1992): 4-partition into C₆-free parts (ε = 1/4)
- Conder (1993): 3-coloring (ε = 1/3)
mathContext: The hypercube Qₙ has 2ⁿ vertices and n·2ⁿ⁻¹ edges.

title: Hypercube Graph
content:
**Hypercube n:**

Vertices: Fin (2^n) (binary strings of length n)

Adjacency: x ~ y iff popcount(x XOR y) = 1 (differ in exactly one bit)

**Properties:**
- |V| = 2ⁿ
- |E| = n·2ⁿ⁻¹
- n-regular

title: Cycles in Graphs
content:
**HasCycle G k:**

G contains a cycle of length k (injective sequence with cyclic adjacency).

**Specific cycles:**
- HasC4: 4-cycle (square)
- HasC6: 6-cycle (hexagon)
- HasC2k: even cycle of length 2k

title: ε-Dense Subgraph
content:
**EpsilonDenseSubgraph n ε H:**

H is a subgraph of Qₙ with at least ε·n·2ⁿ⁻¹ edges.

This captures 'significant fraction' of hypercube edges.

title: Erdős's Conjecture (Disproved)
content:
**ErdosConjecture, erdos_conjecture_false:**

Conjecture: For all ε > 0, sufficiently large n, ε-dense subgraphs of Qₙ contain C₆.

This is FALSE. Counterexample: ε = 1/4 via Chung's partition.

title: Chung's Result (1992)
content:
**chung_1992, chung_counterexample:**

For n ≥ 3, Qₙ can be edge-partitioned into 4 subgraphs, each C₆-free.

Each part has ~1/4 of all edges but contains no 6-cycle.

title: Brouwer-Dejter-Thomassen (1993)
content:
**brouwer_dejter_thomassen_1993:**

Independently proved Qₙ can be 4-colored with no monochromatic C₄ or C₆.

This confirms and extends Chung's result.

title: Conder's Improvement (1993)
content:
**conder_1993, conder_better_bound:**

For n ≥ 3, Qₙ edges can be 3-colored with no monochromatic C₄ or C₆.

This improves Chung/BDT: even denser C₆-free subgraphs exist (ε = 1/3).

title: Generalized Conjecture
content:
**GeneralizedConjecture:**

For k ≥ 3, ∃ c > 0, aₖ < 1 such that ≥ c·n^{aₖ}·2ⁿ edges forces C_{2k}.

Expected: aₖ → 0 as k → ∞.

This remains OPEN.

title: Turán-type for C₄
content:
**turan_c4_hypercube:**

Max edges in C₄-free subgraph of Qₙ is Θ(√n · 2ⁿ).

C₄ requires more edges than C₆ to force.

title: Problem Summary
content:
**erdos_666_summary:**

| Aspect | Result |
|--------|--------|
| Question | ε-dense Qₙ subgraph ⊃ C₆? |
| Answer | NO |
| Chung (1992) | 4-partition, ε=1/4 counterexample |
| Conder (1993) | 3-coloring, ε=1/3 counterexample |
| Generalized | Open for C_{2k} |
